availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
City of Philadelphia

I, John H Frick of Philadelphia, in the State of Pennsylvania, appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky, a Commissioner of Deeds in and for the State of Pennsylvania, to take the acknowledgment of Deeds and other instruments of writing, to be used or recorded in said state of Kentucky, pursuant to Chapter Seventy, of the act of the General assembly of said Commonwealth, entitled "an act to adopt the Revised Statutes," approved January 7. 1852, do solemnly swear that I will well and truly execute and perform all the duties of such Commissinoer to the best of my ability.
Sworn and subscribed before me this 31st day of March a.d. 1862

figure.ab:
JOHN RUSSELL
COMMISISONER
OF
DEEDS
PHILADELPHIA,
PA.

body.p:
John Russell
Commissioner for Kentucky in Phila -- Pa.
I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of a Commission from his Excellency the Governor of Kentucky re-appointing me a Commissioner of Deeds, &c for the state in Pennsylvania.
Agreeable to law, I have taken the oath of office, which is annexed together with my signature and an impression of my official seal for record in your office

I am, very respectfully
your obdt sevt
John H Frick

Nat. Gaither jr
Secretary of State of Kentucky.

Official seal and
signature of
John H Frick

figure.ab:
JOHN H. FRICK
PHILADELPHIA
PENNSYLVANIA
COMMISSIONER

body.p:
Commissioner for Kentucky
no 223 Dock. St

Pennsylvania
Oath
Jno. H. Frick
Comd of Deeds
Filed Apr 4. 1862
